definition: to withdraw/to pull back/to contract/to shrink/to reduce/abbreviation/also pr. [su4]
to lower/to decrease/to reduce/to subtract/to diminish

sentences.english: There was pressure on the university to disinvest in south africa.
sentences.chinese: 这所大学面临在南部非洲缩减投资的压力。

sentences.english: Skeletal Mastery research time reduced to 30 seconds from 45 seconds.
sentences.chinese: 精通招唤骷髅的研发时间从45秒缩减为30秒。

sentences.english: Excluding the effects of one-time gains, operating losses were pared 32 per cent.
sentences.chinese: 扣除一次性收益影响，该业务营运亏损缩减32%。

sentences.english: But next year, tax rises will make up nearly half of it.
sentences.chinese: 但明年，税收的增长将会弥补一半缩减的开支。

sentences.english: The shore diminishes 3 to 4 cm each year: it's hopeless, " says the scientist.
sentences.chinese: 海岸每年缩减3至4厘米，已经没救了”。

sentences.english: In addition, it offers ptimization of a graphic pallet allowing to reduce a file size.
sentences.chinese: 此外，该软件还提供了允许缩减文件尺寸的图形工具。

sentences.english: This new record low continues the trend of steadily shrinking summer sea ice. "We're already set up for a big loss next year, " Serreze notes.
sentences.chinese: 这次新的最低记录将继续加大夏季海洋冰缩减的趋势。

sentences.english: A hydraulic system is used for loading drilling force so as to greatly reduce the hole forming time.
sentences.chinese: 采用液压系统加载钻进力，极大的缩减了成孔时间。

sentences.english: Its charter business, operated largely by its Lauda Air subsidiary, also could be cut by half.
sentences.chinese: 其子公司劳达航空的包机业务，也可能被缩减一半。

sentences.english: The number of the competitors at last narrowed down to only less than 100.
sentences.chinese: 参赛者的数量竟然缩减到不足100人。

sentences.english: Generally, the reduction falls as the square root of the number of terms in the series.
sentences.chinese: 通常，缩减量随着系列中术语的数量的平方根下降。

sentences.english: With garden space—and budgets—squeezed, flower seed sales are down.
sentences.chinese: 由于种植空间和预算的缩减，花卉种子销量下降。

sentences.english: Companies have always tried to put their customers first and cut costs.
sentences.chinese: 企业向来都在努力将顾客放在第一位以及缩减成本。

sentences.english: But those same spending cuts and tax increases also threaten economic growth.
sentences.chinese: 但缩减开支，提高税收同样会对经济增长构成威胁。

sentences.english: Condense this paragraph into a few sentences.
sentences.chinese: 把这段文字缩减成几个句子。

sentences.english: Here’s out rundown of five of the best gadget hotels…
sentences.chinese: 在这儿，我们将目标缩减到五个最具科技感的酒店。

definition: to expand/to enlarge/to broaden one's scope
to shrink (in the wash)/fig. to shrink (of profits etc)
to pull back/to shrink/to contract/(physiology) systole
